    • Constructor Detail

      • ImmutableMeshBuilder

        public ImmutableMeshBuilder(float[] vertices,
                            int count,
                            boolean is2D)

        Constructs an ImmutableMeshBuilder.

        If the given array of vertices contains more values than the specified vertex count, only the first count vertices are used.

        Parameters:
        vertices - vertices.
        count - vertex count.
        is2D - true if a vertex is made of two components (x,y).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if vertices is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given vertex count is < 1 or if the array of vertices is not large enough to contain the specified vertex count.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public ImmutableMesh create()

        Creates an ImmutableMesh.

        Returns:
        mesh.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if indices or texture coordinates have not been set.

      • setId

        public ImmutableMesh.ImmutableMeshBuilder setId(int id)

        Sets the id.

        Parameters:
        id - id.
        Returns:
        builder.

      • setIndices

        public ImmutableMesh.ImmutableMeshBuilder setIndices(int[] indices,
                                                     int count)

        Sets the indices for vertices.

        If the given array of indices contains more values than the specified index count, only the first count indices are used.

        Parameters:
        indices - vertices indices.
        count - index count.
        Returns:
        builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if indices is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array of indices is not large enough to contain the expected number of indices or if count < 1.

      • setName

        public ImmutableMesh.ImmutableMeshBuilder setName(String name)

        Sets the name.

        Parameters:
        name - name.
        Returns:
        builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if name is null.

      • setTextureCoordinates

        public ImmutableMesh.ImmutableMeshBuilder setTextureCoordinates(float[] coordinates)

        Sets the texture coordinates.

        If the given array of texture coordinates contains more values than the vertex count, only the first needed number of coordinates are taken, starting from the beginning of the array.

        Parameters:
        coordinates - texture coordinates.
        Returns:
        builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if coordinates is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if coordinates array is not large enough to hold the expected amount (vertex count).
